moves.1. e4: I am white and harzer is black . This game was fast paced and kept me on my heels. I never knew what to expect and really tested my skills.
moves.2. Be2: my first goal is to castle king side.
moves.3. Nf3: now ready to castle king side in my next couple of moves
moves.3... Nd4: black has other plans like get rid of my piece early on in the game. Thats fine with me . I will do the same getting rid blacks pieces early on in the game. This is when I knew that this would be a very fast paced aggressive game.
moves.4... cxd4: let the games the game begin
moves.5... e5: blocks my pawn. I knew by  if I moved c 2 to c3 . black move d4 to c3 to take my white pawn. then  I can take his pawn.
moves.6. c3: getting ready for  a trade of pawns
moves.9... Qb6: queen attacking mode. black is really building up his pieces.
moves.10. a3: I knew  if moved a 2 to a3 black would move back on his bishop attack .
moves.11. Bg5: getting ready to capture this piece later in the game.
moves.11... Bxf2+: I did not see that coming.
moves.12... h6: bishop doomed. I would move my bishop from g5 to f6 to capture the knight before my bishop gets captured its self.
moves.13. Bxf6: Got both blacks knights out of game early on in this game.
moves.14... Rg8: getting ready to go into battle.
moves.15... d6: not sure what was black doing here.
moves.16. Nf3: sets up my trap. My knight is bait. I  was hoping that black  move his bishop from c8 to g4 hoping he could a piece of my knight. Then it  would be a easy capture for my bishop by h5 to g4.
moves.17. Bxg4: easy capture. opsssss I did not realize that black had his rook on g8
moves.17... Rxg4: the one good thing that came out of it is that we both lost pieces.
moves.18... h5: I need to get black to move that rook to  g 3 because that would be a easy pawn capture.
moves.19. h3: sets my bait  hoping my bait would make the rook so I could capture  the  black pawn
moves.19... Rg3: 2 times I set up traps that I put out bait for the other player. Both times  fell for it.
moves.20. Qxh5: My turn I would move my queen to h8 to get a check.
moves.20... Qe3: black has a strong attacking mode on my side of the board.
moves.21. Qh8+: check.  I know black would move his king from  e8 to e7 and that gives me a chance to take his rook.
moves.24. Kh2: moves king up on the hope of capturing the rook.
moves.28. Qc4+: I need to use my rooks some how
moves.28... d5: protects king but did not  realize that I could take his rook on my next turn.
moves.30... Kf6: i need to get that black knight n the top right area because thats my check mate zone.
moves.32. Qd8+: I will use these checks to get him into my checkmate zone.
moves.33... Kf8: not what  you to do. you are now leaving the check mate zone.
moves.35... Kg6: good about staying in that zone. now i need to find a way to checkmate you.
moves.36. Re1: moving my rook for the check mate showdown.
moves.41. g4: this would help my checkmate plan.
moves.41... Kg5: black you only have  5 more  moves
moves.42. Rxe5+: moves my rook to get ready to checkmate
moves.43. Qg8+: From 43 to 47 moves were all  Conditional moves I set up.
